Token.Abstract: PLVPaymentRequest is payment request instance that requires the identifier, amount, coordinate and currency.

Mandatory unique identifier (e.g order number) of the payment request. The ID can be any set of alphanumeric characters [A-Z, a-z, 0-9]. This payment identifier must be included in receipts and will be reflected on payleven's receipt images. Please retain this identifier for your records and for further reference (e.g Refund).

Mandatory unique identifier (e.g order number) of the payment request. The ID can be any set of alphanumeric characters [A-Z, a-z, 0-9]. This payment identifier must be included in receipts and will be reflected on payleven's receipt images. Please retain this identifier for your records and for further reference (e.g Refund).

Mandatory unique identifier (e.g order number) of the payment request. The ID can be any set of alphanumeric characters [A-Z, a-z, 0-9]. This payment identifier must be included in receipts and will be reflected on payleven's receipt images. Please retain this identifier for your records and for further reference (e.g Refund).
Amount to be charged in a decimal format, which must be at least one major currency unit (e.g 1.00 Euro) and cannot be negative or zero.
Amount to be charged in a decimal format, which must be at least one major currency unit (e.g 1.00 Euro) and cannot be negative or zero.
Amount to be charged in a decimal format, which must be at least one major currency unit (e.g 1.00 Euro) and cannot be negative or zero.
Three-letter alphabetic code according to ISO 4217 representing the payment's currency that must match the merchant country's local currency. Supported currencies are EUR, GBP and PLN.
Three-letter alphabetic code according to ISO 4217 representing the payment's currency that must match the merchant country's local currency. Supported currencies are EUR, GBP and PLN.
Three-letter alphabetic code according to ISO 4217 representing the payment's currency that must match the merchant country's local currency. Supported currencies are EUR, GBP and PLN.
Current device coordinate at the time of the payment attempt.
Current device coordinate at the time of the payment attempt.
Current device coordinate at the time of the payment attempt.
Initializes the receiver with the specified identifier, amount, currency, and coordinate.

Parameter.Name: amount
Parameter.Abstract: Payment amount. The value can be fractional, maximum two fraction digits are allowed. When creating NSDecimalNumber from NSString, don't forget to take the current locale and the decimal separator into account.

Parameter.Name: currency
Parameter.Abstract: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code. For example, EUR.
